Reviews.Title: Slight modifications make this PERFECT!
Reviews.Author: Lavignefilms
Reviews.Content: This is a well-built product but needs a bit of "love" to make it really useful.  First you need to shore up the handle locking devices and then you need to add weights to the picture.  Aside from the weights, 1 trip to Lowes is all you need for all of the new parts.Locking devices.  Aside from the pivot point on the 2-part handle system at the back of this rig, remove both the plastic knobs and the carriage bolts that hold all three handle assemblies.  Replace them with the following: (ensure you retain the clear rubber washers!)1/4-20 2 Inch hex bolts. Can be full thread or partial.  Both will fit.1/4-20 Wing nuts.I bought 5 bolts and 6 wing nuts.Make sure that when you are putting everything back together you put the rubber washers back where they were!!  The first time you tighten this new locking system down you will notice the difference.  The previous system is just plain shoddy.To secure weights to the rig (great for balance and comfort when using it in the shoulder rig configuration and maybe for other uses but I haven't found any yet):On the same trip to Lowes:1/4-20 4 inch or longer hex bolt.  This will screw into the bottom of the 2-part handle bit at the back.Washers large enough to hold your weights on to both the rig and the wing nut (explained later)Go to Walmart and get yourself at least 1 x 2.5lb kettle weight and 1 x 5lb kettle weight.  Make sure they are disc-type.The order of assembly for the weights.Take the bolt and screw on a wing-nut (wings should be toward the open end of the bolt not the hex end)Put 2 x washers on the bolt and slide down to the wing nutPut weights on the bolt to suit your needs2 more washers on the boltHold everything together and screw the bolt into the rear of the rig.  The inside is hollow so you will not hit a "stop".  Instead I recommend screwing down about 1.5 inches or so to ensure you are using all of the available threads.Tighten the wing nut down to the washers and lock everything in place.Tada!  Instantly stable shoulder rig and whever else you can think of.PS:  Throw the plastic crap fasteners in the trash so you won't be tempted to ever use them.After these modifications I am more than impressed by this rig, and for the price it just can't be beat.  Especially when under $20 and a little ingenuity solves any real issues.Would have given 5 stars if I didn't need to fix those small issues.

Reviews.Title: Great Stabilization!
Reviews.Author: S. Odea "Sodea"
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I'm very pleased with this product. I bought it for use with my Canon T2i for filming stabilization and let me tell you for the  price (compared to other high end steady cams) you can't beat this product. It is very lightweight, compactable and versatile. So it has exceeded my expectations. The shipping was fast, the price was affordable and the product was just as described. I would definitely recommend this to any film maker on a budget!

Reviews.Title: For the price it works
Reviews.Author: Maurice
Reviews.Content: For what i spent on this item its worth it. You can actually get the job done. If you just starting out or do not have a big budget this item i highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Great Product, Great Price, A Few Drawbacks
Reviews.Author: Daniel
Reviews.Content: I have been using this rig for about a month now and I actually like it a lot. Let me mention the cons first though because I know that's what anybody reading this is looking for.Its modular setup is awesome and makes a lot of sense, but it is pretty annoying if you need to shoot quickly or if you need to change the set up. It's not too bad going from one position to another, but if you're going from fully-closed to a shoulder support position, don't plan on it being quick.The other thing that I'm not too keen on is when you're in the shoulder support position, it places the camera (I shoot on a DSLR) a little too far away and a little too low. It would be perfect positioning if you use an external monitor.All of that being said, I really like this rig. It's very compact when collapsed and surprisingly light for how supportive it is. The different setup options are nice and I've actually been able to use many of them. You can also adjust this rig to fit whatever you need.There are 1/4" screw holes everywhere, so you can attach tons of external components, such as mics or flashes, to the rig. The one issue there is that they're all on moving parts, so you'll likely have to remove those pieces before changing your setup.All in all, you can't beat this product for the price. It's a versatile rig with great support and functionality. I would highly recommend this rig, especially if you're on a budget.

Reviews.Title: Get It, and Don't Look Back!!!!
Reviews.Author: J.Robinson
Reviews.Content: I've seen plenty of camera rigs for more money but I couldn't afford them! The money I invested on this shoulder mount was well spent. This has brought my production and shots to another level. Its awesome to have this on my gear list. I never go hand held, I'll rearrange the shoulder rig into another position and move on!. Its built well for the money you spend. I plan on getting another one soon as back up!

Reviews.Title: PURE NICENESS
Reviews.Author: GOASTAFA
Reviews.Content: Nice for hand held and I can attach my tripod plate at the bottom for quick handheld to tripod action. I love the fact I can put my monitor, sound recorder, light any where I chose. It also bulks up the look of a small still camera video shoot.Pure niceness!

Reviews.Title: Best Thing Ever!
Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: I loved the DSLR rig so much! It very easy to carry around, light weight! So many combinations to choose from! Awesome!!!!

Reviews.Title: Have a purpose, consider spending more
Reviews.Author: Amp
Reviews.Content: For the price it's good... but I really haven't used it much because it looks unprofessional for jobs and for the most part I can get identical results with my ball head monopod and camera. The grips are nice, but the knobs are very cheap which is to be expected. Nice options of customization with all the connections for even being able to attach a light to each handlebar side.

Reviews.Title: Really really good, not perfect
Reviews.Author: Major B. Bizzell III
Reviews.Content: This shoulder rig is a good price, with good build quality.-The rubber/foam grips are useful, however they turn and twist which could lead to problems( squeaking sounds, and mishandling problems )- The tightening knobs, don't tighten quite enough for me, I still get sagging and movement at their tightest, and they are quite large and clunky, getting in the way of my L-brackets. Using wing nuts like one reviewer recommended is recommended ( see what I did there ?)- Made from light weight sturdy metal material!

Reviews.Title: beset bang for your buck.
Reviews.Author: kuhtewd
Reviews.Content: awesome shoulder rig.does exactly what it advertises to do.locks on the bracket are very good and will keep the arms from moving and comes with a tightening wrench.holds the camera firm and steady, even can use as a ground tripod. very versatile and can store away as tight as a small textbook or bible.use a counterweight on the shoulder part if you're going to be filming for a long time, otherwise your back and everything will start to get tired.

Reviews.Title: Very cool mount!
Reviews.Author: Joshua Linscott
Reviews.Content: This is a very cool mount to use for your camera/camcorder! It really helps stabilize shots especially while moving, compared to handheld shots. My only suggestion is somehow counter-balancing some weight on the back so that the whole rig is more even and smooth when you have all your accessories and camera attached!

Reviews.Title: Nice rig...
Reviews.Author: Solaceinsorrow
Reviews.Content: Overall I'm pleased with this rig. I don't think it's made of metal though, it seems to be some sort of plastic, so I'll have to wait and see just how durable it is. I changed some of the plastic nuts to metal wing nuts (please note that the nuts and bolts situated throughout this rig are comprised of BOTH US AND Imperial sizes, so you may have to actually take the unit to the hardware store to get the correct nuts matched). I interchange two cameras on it. Two Canon HF S200's. One with a Raynox wide angle lens and the other with a Letus mini adapter. It's pretty heavy with the latter camera attached, but the former seems like the perfect size/weight ratio. I'll update if there are any failings in this rig.I've uploaded two pics with both cameras set up.

Reviews.Title: Nice but very front heavy
Reviews.Author: Madman361
Reviews.Content: it works nice but it does not sit on my shoulder very well. It always feels like its going to fall off my shoulder. The shoulder bar should be longer or round. I've tried it other ways but still a little awkward

Reviews.Title: Lighter Less Heavy Duty than other models
Reviews.Author: Real Music Lover
Reviews.Content: Overall I like it. My first one broke and it was slightly bigger and more heavy duty so I'm a little worried about this one. When you extend the shoulder slide part all the way and add weight to the back the plastic connector in the middle cant handle the stress and literally split. So for this one when using weights on the back I'll make a point not to extend the shoulder slide all the way.(sacrificing comfort and having the viewfinder a little close for my taste)

Reviews.Title: UNRELIABLE
Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: This rig has fallen apart at every junction that this rig is needed to work. My 5d nearly fell to the floor. I placed a request with Amazon for replacement and I'm waiting to hear from them. I will update.

Reviews.Title: GET IT!
Reviews.Author: Josh
Reviews.Content: Don't think about getting this....just do it! There is nothing even remotely close to as versatile and good as this for the 6o bucks you pay. it has the ability to be all kinds of rigs, most usable for my style is a shoulder mount. The only complaint i have is that some joints will need readjusting cause they will not tighten enough to not move out of place when using, they don't move enough to be a big enough inconvenience to drop aster though.

Reviews.Title: Good deal
Reviews.Author: Hunter Byron
Reviews.Content: This rig is a very versatile rig and for under $50 it is excellent. It really helps in a number of shooting situations. I use it with my D3200 and have been quite impressed. Just for fun I have tried using it on a $3000 cinema camera and it worked although the camera definitely seemed a bit heavy for the rig. The only real drawback I've noticed is that everything likes to to loosen itself on it.

Reviews.Title: Quality product
Reviews.Author: Strictly Amateur
Reviews.Content: I bought this a couple weeks ago and I'm quite pleased with it.  It's well made, has a quality finish and can be configured for a number of different purposes and shooting styles.  The grips are comfortable, the aluminum plate is surprisingly thick, and all the hinges are field repairable.  It has lots of mounting points for accessories and can be folded into a very small volume for storage or transport.Yes, as other reviewers have complained, it's possible to over torque the adjustment knobs.  But that's true of any mechanical appliance.  Use common sense.  If you don't know what "finger tight" means, get a lesson from someone who does.  And if you strip a knob, it's not the end of the world.  1/4-20 fittings can be found in any hardware store.If you'd rather pay four times as much for a "Professional" model, that's fine.  I'm happy with this one.

Reviews.Title: Wow
Reviews.Author: James Reddig
Reviews.Content: Looks great feels great and even smells great. Glad I bought the product. Great price for new as well. Five stars.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: A. Roberts
Reviews.Content: This rig is very easy to configure and offers a lot of options. Light weight too. Comfortable grips. Great balance.

Reviews.Title: Great accessory to stabilize video
Reviews.Author: Jimmy James
Reviews.Content: This rig lets you stabilize camera motion but still have an organic look to it.  The handles offer many customization options, while also folding into a small package.  My wife didn't believe how cheap it was too- accused me of spending more than I did!

Reviews.Title: Only as a backup.
Reviews.Author: Jake Webb
Reviews.Content: You don't want to us this as your main rig. It is very cheap, and snapped in half while I was shooting a wedding. It's a very cool idea, and might be something to purchase just to do specialty shots or to use as a backup in a pinch, but it's certainly not a quality product.

Reviews.Title: Great Rig!
Reviews.Author: DeLaSoul
Reviews.Content: It's very useful and helps me shoot from all types of angles. It's great for film students and a good price! I strongly recommend it. Just keep a close eye on the knobs. Be sure to tighten them up after you're finished with it because I've lost a couple, but luckily I found them.

Reviews.Title: Better Than I Thought
Reviews.Author: Juvenal Vique "JVKyleRayner"
Reviews.Content: I have to admit that it takes a while to get used to it and to adjust it in the way it feels best for you. Once you figure it out, you'll take this with you every time to plan on taking video.It's come so handy that I bought another one for my second camera.

Reviews.Title: Great value!
Reviews.Author: Leonard C. Knight Jr.
Reviews.Content: A great buy! I must admit that I'm cheap and don't want spend much when I'm buying a product for the first time online. I have to give kudos to this rig. All my shoots are now stable with no shaking in my footage. This unit is awesome starter rig for all videographers. The only thing you will need to add is weights to the rear. Other than that, I recommend anyone on a budget to purchase it!

Reviews.Title: defect
Reviews.Author: HyeongSeokSuh
Reviews.Content: I return this product the day I received it. It has defect (I can't adjust the screw because it's messed up badly) and I don't want to adjust handle using screw.

Reviews.Title: 3 weeks and I'm still happy.
Reviews.Author: AG
Reviews.Content: It was a Great price and great product.No need to compare. The fast delivery was a huge plus.So many different options. I'll have to modify it a bit but the price was worth it.

Reviews.Title: great rig for quarters shooting. and geven better for the price
Reviews.Author: Greg G
Reviews.Content: Awesome product. I'm more than happy using this rig. Gives that nice handheld smoothness for my t4i. Once I get a LCD screen to mount on it ill be more happy. For the money def worth it.

Reviews.Title: It's ok.
Reviews.Author: Colbie
Reviews.Content: Of course you get what you pay for. Great stabilizer but uncomfortable after using for a while. Like I said, good for the price of it. If you have back problems, I don't recommend this.

ProductInfo.Name: Flashpoint DSLR Shoulder Rig Support bracket with handle bars for 15mm rods
